comments.commentBody: According to a certain papyrus scroll, at a certain point during the time of the Pharaohs, a group of pyramid builders who had not been paid or fed, went on strike, occupied a temple, and refused to back down, even when confronted by the local Administrators, the Mayor of the city,and the police. Finally, they were paid and fed, and presumably went back to building the royal tombs. Egyptian civilization has a history spanning several millennia, dense with subtleties unimagined by the U.S. Hollywood epic movie machine, which has produced a distorted and gaudy image of Egypt starring Elizabeth Taylor and the Treasures of King Tut. We are caught by surprise and amazed because we know so little, in truth, about the other peoples of the world, living as we do in our relatively narrow and self-absorbed "reality" show. Here is to the youth of Egypt and Tunisia and Yemen and perhaps Iran and onward across the world for standing up for their futures; for realizing that the future is theirs to win or lose. It is fitting that in the cradle of one of the first great civilizations, civilization should take another leap forward. Let us hope.

New York City has changed so much over the years. In my opinion, the recent building boom completely changed the face of the city. Brownstones and Pre-War buildings are becoming a thing of the past (unfortunately). All to make way for 50 story, glass and steal condo buildings. I don't know any other city, besides Dubai, that has had such an incredible building boom over the past 10 years.

Apartment life became attractive because the managers would take care of maintenance problems, such as roofs and gutters.  I also heard that town houses were going for next to nothing during WWII because of fear of air raids.  Until recently apartment houses on Fifth and other good locations included maids rooms in the apartments or in separate wings.  Note that Nelson A Rockefeller purchased a large apartment in 810 as a young married man with ambitions in real estate and government.  He also purchased one of the apartments in 812 on approximately the same level, upon completion of that 1961 building.  Upon divorce, the first Mrs. Rockfeller retained all or most of the 810 place, while the governor and his second wife occupied an apartment at 812, and perhaps space in 810, but used the entrance to 812.  It was reported that the governor tried to get the city to condemn the entire block between Central Park West and Broadway, between 62d and 63rd, for a park, so there would be a green corridor to Lincoln Center and a view of it from his apartments.  The scheme failed forever when developers got approval for and built the huge structure on Broadway that is set back in its upper floors.

a few comments assert that as 'renters' instead of homeowners, they do not pay income taxes on mortgage interest, or property taxes or property maintenance costs. Baloney. Landlords pass their expenses onto landlords. Rent does, indeed, pay proprety tax, maintenance costs and rent sometimes reimburses an owner for their interest deductions. Most real property owners that rent their real property do so to make a profit, right?  Comments here make it sound like renters don't pay property taxes.  Baloney.  I have lived in Massachusetts, Michigan, Illinois, Minnesota, Nebraska, Washington State and now California.  I have owned homes but mostly I have rented and all my landlords charged me for their property taxes. It is a fallacy to believe renters do not 'pay' taxes.  Landlords don't actually pay property taxes:  they make their renters pay, right?

Well... I got a question, if CC opts out, the next team is commited to pay him what his current contract says?

If so, He may be with us in 2012, but if not... the He may be looking for a place to win, and if Bo-Sox or Phillies do so this year, we could se him again in the National League .. or worse.....

Hope not, since He's been great so far for the Yankees.

Regards.
Is funny, Hughes appears to be fattener than CC in the Pic. =)

Oliver Perez is the single largest mistake ever made by an organization that has made it's fair share of them.  Curious that his velocity inexplicably dropped 7 mph when steroid testing started.  Why hasn't this been mentioned?

To any comment writers who have asserted that they do not benefit from 'government benefits': did you go to public grade school or high school? or public university? I know education is mostly funded by local/state taxes, not federal but anyone who went to free public school has benefited from government 'benefits'. Also, public libraries. Also, research done at government agencies to better humankind. Roads, sewers, the judiciary (local and federal). Clean air.

There are tax dollars, and usually federal tax dollars, involved in many aspects of virtually everyone's life.

I just don't understand what kind of world the small government advocates want to live in. Do such people seriously believe the rich who accepted the Bush tax cuts without investing their tax savings in the past ten years to benefit the economy would start funding nonprofits that would replace all the things government benefits provide society?

I am sure we could design a much more equitable distribution of the earth's wealth. I am sure the federal government and local and state governments waste money. But I don't want to live in a world that looks like Charles Dickens' London, with roving packs of homeless, family-less children and poor houses and humans allowed to starve to death while pleading, please, sir, for a little more food. I am sure we could design a better system of organizing the things we all have a 'right' to, such as roads, health care, hospitals, education, libraries, food when we can't work, shelter when we can't work, clean air, power systems and tools to live our lives. And transportation. Does anyone not benefit from the federal system of interstate highways? Don't kid yourselves folks, if you are thinking you don't 'benefit' from any government programs. You have things in your home right now that were affordable to you only because the federal government benefited your personal life by building an interstate highway and rail system to transport goods and food.

We all benefits from sharing the earth's resources. We need an equitable system to distribute the earth's bounty. Being born rich should not be a golden ticket to prosperity anymore than being born without wealth should guarantee a lifetime of want. We need a system to order ourselves and provide what billions of humans need to sustain life. Communism didn't work so let's try some new stuff. New economic approaches are happening all over. Change is coming. It comes slow.

In America, money controls everything and everyone; from the Supreme Court to the halls of congress, most members can be easily bought.  Anita Hill was right testifying against Thomas's nomination to the bench; a shallow man.   Anyone or any policy the Republicans enacted eventually diminishes American democracy.

How low the court has fallen. Where once judicial giants treaded -- men of great learning, absolute integrity, and massive intellect -- now parade the grotesque, cynical, vile and the bought and paid for. There are no words to express the disgust that I feel. We have been betrayed.

Being reimbursed for "an undisclosed amount for four days of “transportation, meals and accommodations” over the weekend of the retreat" is NOT a brief drop by but outright corruption. It looks like Clarence Thomas sells his court decisions.
Common Cause is doing a great service.  Why isn't this man subject to impeachment?

The conservatives are against judicial activism. Unless it's a conservative judge ruling for them on a conservative cause.

It appears Thomas may have acted illegally. Perhaps he can orchestrate a ruling to mitigate that.

Banana Republic chinos for all!

People like the Koch brothers and others like them need to pay attention to what happened in Egypt this month.  If the wealthy and the large corporations continue to buy our government and young people do not have opportunities the same will happen in this country.
Clarence Thomas is a national disgrace. He should be removed from his position on the Supreme Court!!!
The man has no soul, spirit, nor intellect. He would be pitied if he were not so arrogant.
Clarence Thomas is probably wondering what the fuss is about? He differs from Scalia in the sense that the latter is clever and venal. Thomas, on the other hand is just plain stupid.
Apparently Clarence Thomas has no qualms about being a token for the Koch brothers. Is this a great country or what?
Oh, yeah. If corporations are people now, then how can anyone own them? That is slavery!
Dear Average Americans: Don't you think it's time you took your country back from the wealthiest and most selfish members of your nation?

Clarence Thomas is a stooge for the GOP plain and simple.
Justice Thomas was nominated by George H. W. Bush to continue to give the Reinquist Court, now the Roberts Court the majority. Clarence Thomas does not have the intelligence of the other justices on the supreme court. He is just there to be that breathing, living, voting, ( the way he is told to vote ) stooge for the republican party.
Seems like we need to take a lesson from the Egyptians and occupy the steps to the SCOTUS until Thomas resigns or is impeached!
You get what you pay for.

While I understand the need for the Supreme Court to be insulated from the vagueries of the whims of special interests sweeping the country at one time or another, there simply must be a way to remove a corrupt justice from office, who simply can't get it through his thick skull that he (and his family) are EXPECTED to stay out of political debate.
From the time he was selected, Justice Thomas has impressed me as a man who enjoys sticking it to the court by his outrageous behavior.
Now his wife is, at his side, promoting judicial opinions in political speeches around the country.
This, I will say again, is outrageous and should not be tolerated.
How can we permanently recuse Justice Thomas from further service on our Supreme Court?
The Supreme Court died giving the 2000 election to George W. Bush. It is a Republican advocacy group.
